comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content:
Audience comments from the Caribbean Photographic Memories session, Leeds West Indian Centre, October 2013:

Quite a few wartime service men returned to the UK after World War Two and several in Leeds are still alive. Arthur France said many still belong to the Caribbean Cricket Association in Leeds, or come in regularly to the Leeds West Indian Centre. Carl Hylton indicated that we need to make opportunities to get them to talk about their wartime experiences and early life in Leeds. Audrey Dewjee talked about Nadia Cattouse, who was born in British Honduras and served in Scotland as a signals operator – she had been well treated there. She is almost ninety years old now and lives in London.
